About Us

The Statistics 100 Team is dedicated to helping students on the U of I campus learn and understand basic statistical concepts. We do this in a way that students tell us is both easy to understand and informative!
Stat 100 is unique because we do not teach statistics by memorizing formulas, instead we make sure students understand the concepts and ideas by using our own data taken in class through surveys, a fill in the blank notebook, pre-lectures videos, and a wide variety of tools to help facilitate learning for a large diverse group of students.
Both the instructors and TAs want you to get the most out of the class and are willing to help in any way that they can. Hope you enjoy your semester with us!

Instructors

Karle Flanagan

Hi everyone! My name is Karle and I'm one of the stat 100 instructors. I've always loved math, statistics, and education. Teaching stat 100 is the perfect job for me since I can help students from many different majors gain an appreciation for all 3.

A few other things about me: I'm a huge Illini fan- I went to school at UIUC, met my husband at UIUC, and now I work here. U of I is one of my favorite places in the world! I also enjoy spending time outside, playing piano, water skiing, snow skiing, and traveling.

Student Educators

My name is Jonas and I'm a senior studying statistics and computer science. I completed my associates in 2018 with a major in computer science. In addition to working as a Teaching Assistant and Web Developer for STAT 100 I'm also a Grading Assistant for STAT 400 and STAT 410. I was born and raised in Champaign so I'm used to cornfields - but I love mountains and the coasts much more! I enjoy reading, gaming, playing piano, hiking, and talking with friends.

Other than working as a Stat 100 TA, I work at the front desk of Newman Hall. Other things about me: I am obsessed with my dog (please ask to see pictures), I am from a small town 30 minutes south of campus named Tuscola, and I watch an unhealthy amount of Friends!

My name is Bing and I'm a graduate student in the Gies College of Business getting a M.S. in Management. I just graduated from UIUC this past May with my undergraduate degree in psychology with an economics minor on a pre-medical track. I have been helping with t he STAT 100 course for 2 years now. I'm also a Course Assistant for the iMBA program and a Research Assistant in a psych research lab on campus. I grew up in Chicago and spend most of my free time trying new recipes and watching an absurd amount of Netflix (please send me show recs).

Alex Wang

My name is Alex Wang and I graduated in May 2019 with a double major in Statistics and Economics with a minor in Spanish and am now pursuing a Master's of Science in Statistics. I am from the Northwest Suburbs of Chicago and attended William Fremd High School in Palatine. I TA for STAT 100 because it is the first statistics class I took in my life and I enjoyed it a great deal. This course propelled me to eventually major and pursue a Masters in the field. I hope to teach other's STAT 100 so that they enjoy the class as much as I did and come away with as much practical knowledge as possible.. I really like playing basketball in my free time, but I'm always down to play/watch almost any sport. I enjoy being outside and enjoying the weather when it is nice out. When it is raining I enjoy watching shows and movies.

We are dedicated to helping students on the U of I campus learn and understand basic statistical concepts so they can understand and make sense of things that are interesting or important to them.
